clinical_study.brief_title: An Innovation During the Surgical Wait; Evaluation of the Opportunity for Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: An Innovation During the Surgical Wait; Evaluation of the Opportunity for Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will compare the differences in the scores between the baseline questionnaire (at diagnosis) and the second questionnaire (at treatment) in the RADS II patients that enrolled in pre-treatment trials versus those that don't.

primary_outcome.description: To determine if there are improvements in the measurements of anxiety through quality of life questionnaires completed at 2 different time points when participating in a window of opportunity trial verses not participating in a window of opportunity trial.

arm_group.description: All participants will complete the GAD-7 and Cancer Locus of Control Scale - Course of Illness Subscale questionnaires and additional tissue will be collected at the time of the diagnostic biopsy.

intervention.description: All participants recruited will complete a questionnaire prior to their breast biopsy and then again approximately one week before their surgery. The questionnaire is focused on the level of anxiety patients experience during the wait time between diagnosis and surgery. Additional tissue will be collected at the time of the diagnostic biopsy.

biospec_descr.textblock: Additional tissue samples will be collected at the time of initial biopsy. The samples will be stored for neoadjuvant studies that the patient may choose to participate in during the wait time between diaganosis and surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Women with BIRADS 4/5 on initial mammogram.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 years of age
- Diagnosis of BI-RADS 4 and 5 (highly suspicious for carcinoma) on an initial imaging
- >2cm area of disease
- Provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous neo-adjuvant therapy
- Patients with recurrent disease
